authors.author: John Bacchus Dykes | John H. Newman

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Lead kindly light
Amid th' encircling gloom
Lead Thou me on
The night is dark
And I am far from home
Lead Thou me on
Keep Thou my feet
I do not ask to see
The distant scene
One step enough for me

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
I was not ever thus
Nor prayed that Thou
Shouldst lead me on
I loved to choose and see my path
But now lead Thou me on
I loved the garish day
And spite of fears
Pride ruled my will
Remember not past years

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Mean time along the
Narrow rugged path
Thyself hast trod
Lead Savior lead me home
In childlike faith
Home to my God
To rest forever after earthly stirife
In the calm light of everlasting life
